page.title: 16Local Sports and Pastimes 3
page.content: HOUND TRAILS attract a considerable following and can take place virtually any where at the permission of the local landowner. The dogs used are the same as those used for hunting foxes but are kept by individuals rather than being kept as a pack. The trail is set by a man who drags a pile of rags soaked in a mixture of paraffin and aniseed over several miles of countryside.When it is complete the dogs are released and run a circular course returning to their owners who encourage them with shouts,whistles and a bowl of food. Competition is fierce and betting on favoured dogs is often heavy. The dogs are exercised regularly and trained for big events as conscientiously as an athlete.
